Check the appropriate box below if the Form 8-K filing is intended to simultaneously satisfy the filing obligation of the Registrant under any of the following provisions: &nbsp; &#9744; Written communications pursuant to Rule 425 under the Securities Act (17 CFR 230.425) &nbsp; &#9744; Soliciting material pursuant to Rule 14a-12 under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.14a-12) &nbsp; &#9744; Pre-commencement communications pursuant to Rule 14d-2(b) under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.14d-2(b)) &nbsp; &#9744; Pre-commencement communications pursuant to Rule 13e-4(c) under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.13e-4(c)) &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Item&nbsp;5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. The Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Apple Inc. was held on February&nbsp;28, 2017. At the Annual Meeting, Apple&#146;s shareholders voted on the following nine proposals and cast their votes as described below. &nbsp; 1. The individuals listed below were elected at the Annual Meeting to serve as directors of Apple until the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors are duly elected and qualified: &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; For &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; Against &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote &nbsp; James Bell &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,089,673,529 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 10,471,435 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 7,676,486 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; &nbsp; Tim Cook &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,087,199,318 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 14,905,298 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 5,662,834 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; Al Gore &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,022,575,889 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 78,176,582 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 7,014,979 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; &nbsp; Bob Iger &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,086,241,978 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 15,317,752 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 6,207,720 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; Andrea Jung &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 2,957,214,003 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 139,669,704 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 10,883,743 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; &nbsp; Art Levinson &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,052,101,247 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 48,201,268 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 7,464,935 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; Ron Sugar &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,079,634,871 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 20,163,597 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 7,968,982 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; &nbsp; Sue Wagner &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 3,090,537,929 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 9,962,633 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 7,266,888 &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; &nbsp; 2. A management proposal to ratify the appointment of Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP as Apple&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm for 2017, as described in the proxy materials. This proposal was approved. &nbsp; For &nbsp; Against &nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote 4,478,312,722 &nbsp; 35,312,155 &nbsp; 17,161,987 &nbsp; 0 &nbsp; 3. An advisory resolution to approve executive compensation, as described in the proxy materials. This proposal was approved. &nbsp; For &nbsp; Against &nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote 2,946,520,818 &nbsp; 146,195,145 &nbsp; 15,051,487 &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; 4. An advisory resolution on the frequency of shareholder votes on executive compensation, as described in the proxy materials. A majority of shareholders voted for &#147;1 Year.&#148; &nbsp; 1&nbsp;Year &nbsp; 2&nbsp;Years &nbsp; 3&nbsp;Years &nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote 2,779,412,604 &nbsp; 8,051,658 &nbsp; 311,483,149 &nbsp; 8,820,039 &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 Based on these results, and consistent with Apple&#146;s recommendation, the Board has determined that Apple will hold an advisory vote on executive compensation every year. &nbsp; 5. A shareholder proposal entitled &#147;Charitable Giving &#150; Recipients, Intents and Benefits,&#148; as described in the proxy materials. This proposal was not approved. &nbsp; For &nbsp; Against &nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote 64,942,726 &nbsp; 2,908,356,290 &nbsp; 134,468,434 &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 6. A shareholder proposal regarding diversity among Apple&#146;s board of directors and senior management, as described in the proxy materials. This proposal was not approved. &nbsp; For &nbsp; Against &nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote 146,045,080 &nbsp; 2,826,316,979 &nbsp; 135,405,391 &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; 7. A shareholder proposal entitled &#147;Shareholder Proxy Access Amendments,&#148; as described in the proxy materials. This proposal was not approved. &nbsp; For &nbsp; Against &nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote 984,699,025 &nbsp; 2,102,271,791 &nbsp; 20,796,634 &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; 8. A shareholder proposal entitled &#147;Executive Compensation Reform,&#148; as described in the proxy materials. This proposal was not approved. &nbsp; For &nbsp; Against &nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote 67,856,548 &nbsp; 3,018,354,923 &nbsp; 21,555,979 &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 &nbsp; 9. A shareholder proposal entitled &#147;Executives to Retain Significant Stock,&#148; as described in the proxy materials. This proposal was not approved. &nbsp; For &nbsp; Against &nbsp; Abstained &nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Vote 747,724,576 &nbsp; 2,337,705,980 &nbsp; 22,336,894 &nbsp; 1,423,019,414 SIGNATURE Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Apple Inc.
